verses.verse: "But now <WH6258> those <WH6810> younger <WH6810> than <WH4480> I mock <WH7832> me, Whose <WH834> fathers I disdained <WH1> to put <WH3988> with the dogs <WH7896> of my flock. <WH3611>
"Indeed, <WH1571> what <WH4100> [good was] the strength <WH3581> of their hands <WH3027> to me? Vigor <WH3624> had perished from them.
"From want <WH2639> and famine <WH3720> they are gaunt <WH1565> Who gnaw <WH6207> the dry <WH6723> ground by night <WH570> in waste <WH9585> and desolation, <WH4875>
Who pluck <WH6998> mallow <WH4408> by the bushes, <WH7880> And whose food <WH3899> is the root <WH8328> of the broom <WH7574> shrub. <WH7574>
"They are driven <WH1644> from the community; <WH9073> They shout <WH7321> against <WH5921> them as [against] a thief, <WH1590>
So that they dwell <WH7931> in dreadful <WH6178> valleys, <WH5158> In holes <WH2356> of the earth <WH6083> and of the rocks. <WH3710>
"Among <WH996> the bushes <WH7880> they cry <WH5101> out; Under <WH8478> the nettles <WH2738> they are gathered <WH5596> together. <WH5596>
"Fools, <WH1121> <WH5036> even <WH1571> those <WH1121> without <WH1097> a name, <WH8034> They were scourged <WH5217> from the land. <WH776>
"And now <WH6258> I have become <WH1961> their taunt, <WH5058> I have even become <WH1961> a byword <WH4405> to them.
"They abhor <WH8581> me [and] stand <WH7368> aloof <WH7368> from me, And they do not refrain <WH2820> from spitting <WH7536> at my face. <WH6440>
"Because <WH3588> He has loosed <WH6605> His bowstring <WH9199> and afflicted <WH6031> me, They have cast <WH7971> off <WH7971> the bridle <WH7448> before <WH4480> <WH6440> me.

"On the right <WH3225> hand <WH3225> their brood <WH6526> arises; <WH6965> They thrust <WH7971> aside my feet <WH7272> and build <WH5549> up against <WH5921> me their ways <WH734> of destruction. <WH343>
"They break <WH5420> up my path, <WH9350> They profit <WH3276> from my destruction, <WH1942> No <WH3808> one restrains <WH5826> them.
"As [through] a wide <WH7342> breach <WH6556> they come, <WH857> Amid <WH8478> the tempest <WH9585> they roll <WH1556> on.

"Terrors <WH1091> are turned <WH2015> against <WH5921> me, They pursue <WH7291> my honor <WH5082> as the wind, <WH7307> And my prosperity <WH3444> has passed <WH5674> away <WH5674> like a cloud. <WH5645>
"And now <WH6258> my soul <WH5315> is poured <WH8210> out within <WH5921> me; Days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> have seized <WH270> me.
"At night <WH3915> it pierces <WH5365> my bones <WH6106> within <WH4480> <WH5921> me, And my gnawing <WH6207> [pains] take <WH7901> no <WH3808> rest. <WH7901>
"By a great <WH7230> force <WH3581> my garment <WH3830> is distorted; <WH2664> It binds <WH247> me about as the collar <WH6310> of my coat. <WH3801>
"He has cast <WH3384> me into the mire, <WH2563> And I have become <WH4911> like <WH4911> dust <WH6083> and ashes. <WH665>
"I cry <WH7768> out to Thee for help, <WH7768> but Thou dost not answer <WH6030> me; I stand <WH5975> up, and Thou dost turn <WH995> Thy attention <WH995> against me.
"Thou hast become <WH2015> cruel <WH393> to me; With the might <WH6108> of Thy hand <WH3027> Thou dost persecute <WH7852> me.
"Thou dost lift <WH5375> me up to the wind <WH7307> [and] cause me to ride; <WH7392> And Thou dost dissolve <WH4127> me in a storm. <WH8663>
"For I know <WH3045> that Thou wilt bring <WH7725> me to death <WH4194> And to the house <WH1004> of meeting <WH4150> for all <WH3605> living. <WH2416>
"Yet <WH389> does not one in a heap <WH5856> of ruins <WH5856> stretch <WH7971> out [his] hand, <WH3027> Or <WH518> in his disaster <WH6365> therefore <WH3651> cry <WH7769> out for help <WH7769>?
"Have I not wept <WH1058> for the one whose life <WH3117> is hard <WH7186>? Was not my soul <WH5315> grieved <WH5701> for the needy <WH34>?
"When <WH3588> I expected <WH6960> good, <WH9185> then evil <WH9563> came; <WH935> When I waited <WH3176> for light, <WH216> then darkness <WH652> came. <WH935>
"I am seething <WH7570> within, <WH4578> and cannot <WH3808> relax; <WH1826> Days <WH3117> of affliction <WH6040> confront <WH6923> me.
"I go <WH1980> about mourning <WH6937> without <WH3808> comfort; I stand <WH6965> up in the assembly <WH6951> [and] cry <WH7768> out for help. <WH7768>
"I have become <WH1961> a brother <WH251> to jackals, <WH8565> And a companion <WH7453> of ostriches. <WH1323> <WH3284>
"My skin <WH5785> turns <WH7835> black <WH7835> on me, And my bones <WH6106> burn <WH2787> with fever. <WH2721>
"Therefore my harp <WH3658> is turned <WH1961> to mourning, <WH60> And my flute <WH5748> to the sound <WH6963> of those who weep. <WH1058>
